title: The Blessed Garden
devotional:
Eliza always considered her grandmother’s garden a magical place. Not because of rare flowers or exotic plants, but because of the sheer abundance of ordinary vegetables and herbs that thrived there. Every year, Grandma Rose would produce enough tomatoes, zucchini, and basil to feed half the town. And every year, she’d say the same thing: “The Lord has blessed this little patch of earth.”

As Eliza grew older, she began to understand that her grandmother wasn’t just talking about the weather or the soil. She was talking about a deep, abiding sense of gratitude for the simple gifts of life. Grandma Rose approached her garden not as a chore, but as a sacred space, a place where she could connect with the Creator and experience His abundant provision.

One autumn day, as Eliza helped Grandma Rose harvest the last of the season’s crops, she noticed a subtle change in her grandmother’s usual enthusiasm. The weather had been particularly harsh that year, and some of the plants had withered and died. Eliza asked, “Grandma, are you still feeling blessed, even though some of the garden didn’t do so well this year?”

Grandma Rose smiled gently and replied, “Blessing isn’t just about abundance, dear. It’s about recognizing God’s hand in every season. Even when things are scarce, there’s still so much to be grateful for. The sun still shines, the rain still falls, and we still have each other. And most importantly, we still have God’s love.”

Eliza realized that her grandmother had discovered a profound truth: blessing isn't a feeling, but a perspective. It’s about choosing to see the good in every situation, even when it’s hard. It's about recognizing God’s presence and provision, not just in the harvest, but in the seed, the soil, and the sunshine. It is also not about comparing ourselves to others, but to embrace ourselves.

Today, remember Grandma Rose’s wisdom. No matter what challenges you may be facing, choose to focus on the blessings in your life. Look for the simple gifts, the unexpected moments of grace, and the unwavering love of God that surrounds you. Embrace the season, and accept the knowledge that it is a blessing to be able to experience it all. When we cultivate an attitude of gratitude, we open ourselves to receive even greater blessings in the future.
image_description: A close-up of ripe, red tomatoes growing in a vegetable garden on a sunny autumn day, interspersed with sprigs of green herbs.
insights: The concept of blessing is deeply rooted in scripture. Deuteronomy 28 outlines the blessings that come from obedience to God’s commands, but Jesus expanded our understanding of blessing in the Beatitudes (Matthew 5:3-12), emphasizing that blessing is not always tied to material wealth or easy circumstances. Instead, He highlighted the blessedness of those who are poor in spirit, those who mourn, and those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake. These verses reveal that blessing is often found in unexpected places, and that it’s ultimately about our relationship with God.
prayer: Dear Lord, thank you for the countless blessings in my life, both big and small. Help me to cultivate an attitude of gratitude and to see your hand in every season. Even when I face challenges, remind me of your unwavering love and provision. Teach me to find joy in the simple gifts and to trust that you are always with me. In Jesus’ name, Amen.
reflection: What are some of the blessings you’ve overlooked in your life lately? How can you cultivate a greater sense of gratitude, even in the midst of difficult circumstances? How can you share your blessings with others?
